intro: Plectocomia sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran plectocomia, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sumatra. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in the summer months. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forest areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
